properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in effect on Macquarie St in the Sydney CBD for a 24 hour arts & culture festival, Mopoke Sydney, starting from 6pm Saturday 4 to 6pm Sunday 5 February.

Macquarie St will be closed between Hunter St and Prince Albert Rd from 6am Sat 4 Feb until 11:59pm Sun 5 Feb. Motorists will be detoured via Elizabeth St.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 5am Sat 4 Feb until 11:59pm Sun 5 Feb on the western side of Macquarie St from Prince Albert Rd to Hunter St. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie Street

properties.publicTransport: Routes 166, 167 and 177 buses will divert or end trips early while roads are closed along the course. Visit transportnsw.info for more info and to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sun Run 7km and 10km fun run events will start from 6:15am from The Strand in Dee Why and finish by 9:30am at South Steyne in Manly. Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect. All roads will re-open by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

Road closures:

  • Dee Why - 3.30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde. Crossover maintained on Oaks Ave at The Strand eastbound until 5:15am and westbound until 6am. 
  • Curl Curl to Freshwater - 5:30am to 9am: Griffin Rd, Pitt Rd, Abbott Rd, Carrington Pde and local surrounding roads will be closed. Crossover maintained on Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde in both directions and on Playfair Rd, Ross Rd at Pitt Rd until 6am. 
  • Queenscliff - 5.30am to 10am: sections of Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd, Dowling St, Lumsdaine Dr and surrounding local roads. Crossover maintained westbound (exit only) on Crowd Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am-6:15am and 9am-10am. 
  • Manly - 3.30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads. Managed access for Cameron Ave residents from 5.30am-9am.
  • Manly - 3.30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3am until 9am along sections of roads in Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly including sections of Abbott Rd, Howard Ave, The Strand, Evans St, Crown Rd and North Steyne. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, use the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle cross over points have been established to facilitate resident access where possible. To ensure the safety of runners, these points will be closed to vehicles whilst runners pass through. During this time there will be no vehicle access from the following areas.

Dee Why and North Curl Curl - residents between the course and the coastline no access while crossovers closed

Curl Curl and Freshwater - residents of cul-de sac roads off the western side of the course no access until roads reopen

  • Dee Why The Strand at Oaks Ave crossover eastbound 5:15am â€“ 7:15am
  • Dee Why The Strand at Oaks Ave crossover westbound 6:00am â€“ 7:15am
  • Dee Why Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 7:30am
  • North Curl Curl Griffin Rd at Headland Rd crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 7:30am
  • North Curl Curl Pitt Rd at Playfair Rd crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 8:00am
  • North Curl Curl Pitt Rd Ross St > Pitt Rd > Playfair Rd and vice versa crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 8:00am

Queenscliff and Freshwater - residents between the course and the coastline no access while crossover closed

  • Queenscliff Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St, managed exit westbound only from 5:30am - 6:15am and 9am - 10am, crossover closed 6:15am â€“ 9am.

Manly

  • Managed access to/from Cameron Ave via Collingwood St only 5:30am-9:30am

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: The Strand, Griffin Road, North Steyne & South Steyne
roads.suburb: Dee Why, Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff, Manly

properties.otherAdvice:
Dave Chappelle at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday and Sunday. Doors open 5pm, show start from 6pm, finish around 9.30pm.

Multiple events are taking place in the precinct each night with a concert at neighbouring Accor Stadium on Saturday and music festival at Sydney Showground on Sunday.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event each night.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
St Jerome's Laneway Festival at Sydney Showground, 11am to 11pm.

Multiple events are taking place in the precinct on Sunday with a show at neighbouring Qudos Bank Arena.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Tasmania Jackjumpers. Tip-off from 5:30pm, finish around 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Light rail services and buses run frequently to Moore Park so leave the car at home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Central Coast Mariners at Allianz Stadium. Gates open 2pm, women's kick off 2.20pm, men's kick off 5pm, finish 6.45pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 1pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 car park will be closed for this game.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 8pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)

  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Cabramatta Lunar New Year Festival from 11am to 8pm.

Local roads will be closed before, during and after the event.

  • Park Rd and Arthur St between Hughes St and Railway Pde will be closed from 8pm Friday 3 February until 2am Sunday 5 February.
  • Arthur St Car Park will be closed from 8pm Friday 3 February until 2am Monday 6 February 
  • Hughes St Car Park will remain open. Taxis will have access into Arthur St slip lane. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads around the the event site. Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

roads.mainStreet: Arthur Street

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Western United FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 3pm, finish around 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.otherAdvice:
NSW Premier's Gala Concerts and Seniors Festival Expo at Aware Super Theatre and ICC Sydney on Thursday 2 and Friday 3 February. Morning concert starts at 11am each day, afternoon concert starts at 2.45pm. Shows finish by 4.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual along Darling Dr and Pier St before and after the shows each day.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Large crowds are expected to attend the Lunar New Year Festival at Eastwood Oval from 3pm to 9pm.

Road closures and changed traffic conditions will be in effect, follow the directions of traffic controllers on site.

  • West Pde will be closed between Hillview Rd and Wingate Ave from 10am to 11pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney WorldPride is a once in a lifetime festival coming to Sydney from 17 February to 5 March 2023. The festival will kick off with the Live & Proud concert at the Domain. Doors open 3pm, show starts from 7pm finishing by 11pm.

With thousands of people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD on Macquarie St, College St and William St. Motorists should allow extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area. Roads will be closed within and outside the Domain to allow crowds to safely arrive and leave the event.

Road closures:

From 7pm to 12.30am

  • Art Gallery Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Mrs Macquaries Rd, and Mrs Macquaries Rd.

From 10pm to 12.30am

  • Cathedral St from St Mary’s Rd
  • College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd
  • Hospital Rd between Prince Albert Rd and Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd 
  • Prince Albert Rd between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • St Mary’s Rd between Yurong Pkwy and Prince Albert Rd

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the Domain from 1pm to 12.30am on College St, Hospital Rd, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, Shakespeare Pl, St James Rd and St Mary’s Rd.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

roads.mainStreet: Art Gallery Road, Macquarie Street, College Street

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert and miss stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Red Hot Chili Peppers with Post Malone at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open 5.30pm, ahead of acts start from 7.15pm, finish around 10.45pm

With thousands of fans expected and another event at neighbouring Qudos Bank Arena on the same night, traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct during the already busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the event. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space as parking will fill quickly.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close prior to full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. Note, traffic changes for Parramatta Light Rail may affect how you travel through Parramatta CBD.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Mardi Gras 2023 - Road closure and clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Mardi Gras 2023 - Road closure and clearway map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Mardi Gras 2023 - Road closure and clearway map
arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 733170_1674627260021_Mardi Gras 2023 - Road closure and clearway map.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sydney Gay & Lesbian Mardi Gras Parade as part of WorldPride is expected to be bigger than ever this year as the parade returns to its traditional on-road route. Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7:30pm until around 11.30pm.

Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place from as early as 2pm and most roads remain closed until 2am Sunday.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES

  • From 2pm to 1am: sections of College St, Wentworth Ave and surounding local streets.
  • From 3pm to 3am: sections of Bourke St, Campbell St and surrounding local streets.
  • From 4pm to 4am: Flinders St between Oxford St and Moore Park Rd, and southbound Anzac Pde from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd, including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open). Anzac Pde closes northbound from 5pm.
  • From 4.30pm to 1am: Liverpool St between Elizabeth St and College St, and local streets in Surry Hills between Elizabeth St and Riley St
  • From 4.30pm to 2am: Oxford St between College St and Darlinghurst Rd, sections of Crown St, sections of South Dowling between Oxford St and Fitzroy St, and local streets off Oxford St.
  • From 6.30pm to 2am: sections of Moore Park Rd and Driver Ave (until 10am Sunday).
  • From 9pm to 1am: sections of Elizabeth St, Castlereagh St and Pitt St between Market and Goulburn streets will close to allow crowds to safely leave the CBD. 

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes.

Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north.  

Pedestrian access across the parade route will be available at Riley St, Crown St and Albion St from 4.30pm to 7pm, after such time there is no pedestrian crossing of Oxford or Flinders Streets available until roads reopen. 

Special event clearways will be in effect between 6am Saturday and 3am Sunday on various roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: via Oxford Street, Flinders Street and Anzac Parade

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on key roads approaching Bathurst including the Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy and Mid Western Hwy. 

Local roads in Bathurst are also expected to be busy and traffic control will be in place. Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time in the area during the event.

The right hand turn lane from Nelson Bay Rd into the venue will be restricted during the event. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend Lunar New Year celebrations along Forest Rd in Hurstville from 12pm to 9pm.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual on roads in the area including King Georges Rd, Queens Rd and Railway Pde during the event. 

The following roads will be closed from 1am to 11.30pm:

  • Forest Rd between Woodville St and Treacy St (Eastbound lanes)
  • Forest Rd between Macmahon St and Woodville St (Eastbound lanes)
  • Macmahon St between Forest Rd and Dora St (Southbound lanes)

Special event clearways will be in effect on the following roads from 7am to 4pm:

  • Forest Rd between Gloucester Rd and Bridge St (Both Sides)
  • Queens Rd between Park Rd and The Avenue (Both Sides)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits and TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

roads.mainStreet: Forest Road

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Australia Day weekend.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Maianbar, and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park. If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park, via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford, will close. Entry will be maintained via McKell Ave at Waterfall for residents only. 

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach.
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township.
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township.

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will manage access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.

Note - Garie Rd remains closed from Sir Bertram Stevens Dr due to road damage.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Australia Day holiday period

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads

properties.otherAdvice:
Lake Mac Festival will be held at Thomas Halton Park, Croudace Bay from 8am Saturday 28 to 5pm Sunday 29 January.

A 40km/h speed limit will be in place around the event area and increased pedestrian activity is expected so motorists are reminded to follow signage and exercise caution.

Road shoulder closures will be in place on Bareki Road for the safety of motorists and pedestrians.

roads.mainStreet: Bareki Road

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Light rail services and buses run frequently to Moore Park so leave the car at home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney 7's at Allianz Stadium. Gates open Friday 11:30am. Gates open Saturday and Sunday 8:45am. Finish each night approx 9pm.

Large crowds are expected over the weekend and traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 9am on Saturday and Sunday, and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area each night. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave. EP2 car park will be closed for the event.

Access to EP3 grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park from 3pm to 10pm on Friday 27 January and from 8am to 11pm on Saturday 28 and Sunday 29 January on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK

FRIDAY 27 JANUARY FROM 3PM TO 10PM AND SATURDAY 28 & SUNDAY 29 JANUARY FROM 8AM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)
